UML:TaggedValue.value:
A package to allow delivering EarthResourceML in a Simple Feature Level 0 format. All cardinalities are 0 to 1, all data types are strings, integers, numbers or anyURI.
Little attempt is made to enforce content standards and relational information is kept to a minimum. This package is designed to allow ready import into simple clients such as GIS and spreadsheet tools.
The package also provides a format for delivering responses to WMS queries.
Class to specify a simple view of an EarthResource feature for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureInfo responses or GML3.1 Simple Feature Level 0 Web Feature Services
A URI to identify the EarthResource feature.
Name of the EarthResource, if applicable.
Captures the type of mineral occurrence. Examples may include prospect, occurrence, mineral deposit, ore deposit, field, district, lode.
The major commodity or commodities found at the EarthResource. Text string values allows concatenation of multiple commodities if required (eg, 'Cu, Au, Pb').
Name of a mine associated with this EarthResource.
Text (possibly formatted with formal syntax) description of the age of the EarthResource (where age is a sequence of events and may include process and environment information).

A simple text label to classify the EarthResource. Systematically arranged information describing the essential attributes of a class of mineral deposits. May be empirical (descriptive) or theoretical (genetic).
The typical geometric shape of the Earth Resource (e.g. lenticular, pipelike, irregular etc)
Name or description of the host geologic unit for the EarthResource
Amount of ore. Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in the value.

The economically mineable part of a Measured and/or Indicated Mineral Resource. It includes diluting materials and allowances for losses, which may occur when the material is mined. ‘Marketable Coal Reserves’ maybe reported in conjunction with, but not instead of, reports of Ore (Coal) Reserves. ‘Saleable product’ (e.g. for industrial minerals) can be reported in conjunction with ore reserve. Synonyms: Ore Reserve; Coal Reserve (s); Diamond (or gemstone) Ore Reserve; Mineral Reserves (not preferred, should be stated that used to mean the same as JORC’s Ore Reserve); Mineable production estimates. Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in value

A concentration or occurrence of material of intrinsic economic interest in or on the Earth’s crust in such form, quality and quantity that there are reasonable prospects for eventual economic extraction. Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in the value. Synonyms: Mineral Resource; Coal Resource (s); Diamond (Gemstone) Resource; Potentially Mineable Mineralisation

Endowment refers to that quantity of a mineral in accumulations (deposits) meeting specified physical characteristics such as quality, size and depth. Usually includes Resources, as unlike the latter, it does not have to have prospects for "eventual economic extraction". It often includes the total amount of a commodity originally introduced to a particular location during the deposit forming processes - and thus can include resources, reserves, past production and mining and metallurgical losses. Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in value.

Description of the method that was used to identify the location of the feature. Examples: global positioning system, published map, field observation, downhole survey, aerial photography, field survey.
Text description of the accuracy of the feature location. Examples: accurate, approximate, diagrammatic, indefinite, unknown, 5 metres, 1 kilometre.
A description of the data source for this EarthResource.
A URI identifier for a value from a controlled vocabulary for the type of mineral occurrence.
A URI to identify the major commodity found at the EarthResource to allow thematic mapping of commodities.

URI referring to a controlled concept specifying the most representative geologic age interval for the EarthResource. This will be defined entirely at the discretion of the data provider and may be a single event selected from the EarthResource's geologic history or a value summarising the all or part of it's history.
URI referring to a value from a controlled vocabulary specifying the most representative older age value for the EarthResource.
URI referring to a value from a controlled vocabulary specifying the most representative younger age value for the EarthResource.
URI to a value from a controlled vocabulary allow creating thematic maps based on the MineralDepositModel property.
URI identifier for the host geologic unit for the EarthResource.
A URI to identify a more complete EarthResourceML description of the feature.
Geometry defining the extent of the feature of interest.
A placeholder allowing any user-defined attributes to be delivered in addition to those specified above.
Class to specify a simple view of a MiningActivity feature for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureInfo responses or GML3.1 Simple Feature Level 0 Web Feature Services
A URI to identify the MiningActivity feature.
Description of the type of mining activity (eg; open cut, underground mine, sluice, unspecified) or processing activity (eg; ore processing, flotation, gravity separation) or production.
The major commodity or commodities found at the MiningActivity. Multiple commodities can be concatenated (eg, 'Cu, Pb, Zn').
The end date of the MiningActivity
The start date of the MiningActivity
Preferred name of the Mine associated with the MiningActivity
The amount of ore processed by the MiningActivity. Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in value
Name of the material produced by the mining activity.
Quantity of product produced during the MiningActivity. Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in value
The relative quantity or percentage of ore mineral content in an orebody. (Could be feed grade, ore grade). Text string datatype so units of measure can be included in value.

The percentage of valuable constituent derived from an ore, or of coal from a coal seam; a measure of mining or extraction efficiency. (Recovery rate is usually expressed as a percent). text string datatype so units of measure can be included in value.

Description of the method that was used to identify the location of the feature. Examples: global positioning system, published map, field observation, downhole survey, aerial photography, field survey.
Text description of the accuracy of the feature location. Examples: accurate, approximate, diagrammatic, indefinite, unknown, 5 metres, 1 kilometre.
A description of the data source for this MiningActivity.
URI identifier to a value from a controlled vocabulary describing the type of mining activity, processing activity or production.
A URI to identify a value from a controlled vocabulary the major commodity associated with the MiningActivity to allow thematic mapping of commodities.
A URI to identify a mineral deposit (EarthResource) associated with the MiningActivity.
A URI to identify a Mine associated with the MiningActivity.
A URI to identify a more complete EarthResourceML description of the MiningActivity feature.
Geometry defining the extent of the feature of interest.
A placeholder allowing any user-defined attributes to be delivered in addition to those specified above.
Class to specify a simple view of a Mine feature for use in Web Mapping Service GetFeatureInfo responses or GML3.1 Simple Feature Level 0 Web Feature Services
A URI to identify the Mine feature.
A description of the operational status of the mine (eg Care & Maintenance, Pending Approval, Operating Continually).

Description of the method that was used to identify the location of the feature. Examples: global positioning system, published map, field observation, downhole survey, aerial photography, field survey.
Text description of the accuracy of the feature location. Examples: accurate, approximate, diagrammatic, indefinite, unknown, 5 metres, 1 kilometre.
A description of the data source for this Mine.
URI to identify a value from a controlled vocabulary for operational status of the mine (eg Care & Maintenance, Pending Approval, operating continually).
A URI to identify a more complete EarthResourceML description of the MiningActivity feature.
Geometry defining the extent of the feature of interest.
A placeholder allowing any user-defined attributes to be delivered in addition to those specified above.
